Accessing OpenStreetMap Data from Python

Installing Required Libraries

To access OpenStreetMap data from Python, you'll need to install the following libraries:

  • OSMnx: For downloading, manipulating, and analyzing street networks.
  • GeoPandas: For working with geospatial data.

You can install these libraries using pip:

pip install osmnx geopandas

Use code with caution.

Downloading Building Footprints for a Given Area

To download building footprints for a specific area, you can use OSMnx's building_footprints function. Here's an example:

import osmnx as ox
import geopandas as gpd

# Specify the geographic coordinates of the area
north, south, east, west = 57.16, 57.13, -2.08, -2.11

# Download building footprints
buildings = ox.building_footprints(north, south, east, west)

# Convert to GeoPandas GeoDataFrame
buildings_gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(buildings)

# Filter buildings by minimum area (optional)
min_area = 1000  # square meters
buildings_filtered = buildings_gdf[buildings_gdf.area >= min_area]

print(buildings_filtered.head())

Use code with caution.

Getting a List of Available Data Sets

To get a list of all available data sets for a given area, you can use OSMnx's geometries_from_place function:

import osmnx as ox

# Specify the place
place = "Aberdeen, Scotland"

# Get available data sets
data_sets = ox.geometries_from_place(place)

print(data_sets.head())

Use code with caution.

Additional Tips

  • Explore OSMnx Documentation: The OSMnx documentation provides detailed information and examples.
  • Customize Queries: You can customize your queries using various parameters like network_type, tags, and more.
  • Visualize Data: Use GeoPandas to visualize the downloaded data, for example, plotting building footprints on a map.
  • Consider Overpass API: For more complex queries, consider using the Overpass API directly.

By following these steps and exploring the capabilities of OSMnx and GeoPandas, you can effectively access and analyze OpenStreetMap data for your specific needs.
